Something about the anniversary version of fable doesn't sit right with me, i have tried finishing this version of the game multiple times, and everytime i would get frustrated. I keep comparing this with the TLC version, more or less the original version of fable, it has the nostalgia factor to it, it smelled like home. But it's somehow better, some of my favorite spells have fancier effects, the new graphics make the game less intimidating. 
Play this version if you want fancy graphics, but stick to the original otherwise. Also, the mess that has happened with the studio was a shitty move, i love the lore, i finished the second game multiple times, but this series, for all it's worth, was pinballed everywhere, please give it some love, play the first and the third game (because the second fable is xbox exclusive </3), and engage with it's story, it's a wonderful experience, i promise.

185280842.review:
В игре прикольная атмосфера, она проходится быстро, есть юмор какой-никакой и прикольные сайд-квесты, весьма простенькая боевка, которая не вынуждает потеть над каждым боем и продумывать наперед, а также нет огромного разнообразия лута, из-за которого постоянно приходилось бы менять шмотки ради чуть лучших статов. Это плюсы, и их достаточно, чтобы я мог советовать игру, особенно длительность радует, игра не успевает надоесть.
Из минусов - ролевые действия игрока неприлично локализованы, а сама игра подталкивает к отыгрышу положительного героя. Например, при убийстве врагов дается плюс к мировоззрению, а это просто мобы, я никому не пытался помочь, а просто фармил опыт... С другой стороны, если пытаться отыгрывать негативного героя, то меняется, в общем-то, ничего, кроме внешности. Да, NPC будут с ужасом разбегаться, но за пределами такого поведения ничего не меняется. Торговцы торгуют, сюжетные персонажи выдают те же реплики, что и обычно, а интерактивные NPC взаимодействуют с героем, будто это не само зло во плоти, а обычный горжанин. Баффов и дебаффов от максинга статов мировоззрения в принципе никаких не обнаружено. Решения героя в ходе сюжета никак не влияют на сам сюжет, финал будет один и тот же...
В ходе прохождения, постоянно посещала мысль о сравнении с первой частью Two Worlds, которая на Fable похожа атмосферой и некоторыми геймплейными элементами, но многократно масштабнее.
В общем и целом, это очень простенькая, довольно наивная история с очевидными недостатками, но со своей атмосферой, из-за которой хочется остаться в игре до финала. Мир небольшой, сюжет короткий - и большое на этом спасибо, за 20 часов пробегается приятно, 60 я бы не выдержал.

184942587.review:
Fable Anniversary - A Timeless Tale Retold: My Journey Through Lionhead's Best

After sinking 75 glorious hours into Fable Anniversary over two playthroughs, I can confidently say that this game isn't just a remaster; it's a love letter to fans of the original Fable and a welcoming embrace for newcomers. 

Visuals and Gameplay:
First off, the graphical update does justice to the whimsical world of Albion. The reimagined textures and lighting breathe new life into environments that were once pixelated and now feel almost painterly. The character models have been given a much-needed facelift; the heroes of Albion look more expressive and detailed than ever. The gameplay mechanics, while keeping the essence of the original, have been polished to feel smoother and more intuitive. Combat is fun, with a good balance between melee, ranged, and magic, allowing for diverse play styles that keep every skirmish engaging.

Narrative and World:
The story of Fable Anniversary remains one of its strongest aspects. Playing through the hero's journey from childhood to becoming the legendary hero of Albion was just as enchanting the second time around. The narrative is filled with humor, heart, and a touch of satire that never gets old. Each quest, whether it’s saving a village from bandits or choosing between good and evil, feels meaningful. The choices you make genuinely impact the world, from how NPCs react to you to the physical changes in your character's appearance based on your moral decisions. This replay value is what kept me engaged for those extra hours, exploring different paths and outcomes.

Sound and Music:
The audio remastering is another highlight. The voice acting is superb, capturing the quirky and melodramatic tone of the game perfectly. The music, composed by Danny Elfman, resonates with the game's mood, enhancing every moment from epic battles to quiet explorations. It’s a soundtrack that you'll find yourself humming long after you've turned off the console.

Community and Extras:
The addition of the "Heroic Difficulty" mode provided a fresh challenge on my second playthrough, making me rethink strategies and enjoy the combat in new ways. The interface for achievements and collectibles is user-friendly, encouraging you to explore every nook and cranny of Albion for those hidden gems or missed items. The community around Fable Anniversary is also vibrant, sharing tips, strategies, and stories which have added another layer of enjoyment to the experience.

Conclusion:
Fable Anniversary not only meets but exceeds expectations set by its predecessor. It's a game that combines nostalgia with modern enhancements, creating an experience that feels both familiar and fresh. After 75 hours, I'm not just satisfied; I'm enchanted, eager for more tales from Albion, and hopeful for what future Fable installments might bring. Whether you're revisiting the land or stepping into it for the first time, Fable Anniversary is a journey worth taking. Here's to hoping the upcoming new Fable title by Playground Games does its legacy justice.

184348752.review:
First time playing this game. I expected there to be a lot of clunkiness and whatnot, because it's a 20 year old game. Believe me, that's not a problem for me. I play games from the 90s just fine, happily. No, the thing that really turned me off Fable is it's just so goofy. 

The voice acting is a piss take. The story is trying to be taken seriously but everyone sounds like they're doing a Monty Python parody of it. 

Yeah it was kind of funny the first time I saw a guard walking around like a cartoon character, but then they show up in important scenes and it's like "I'm sorry, am I supposed to be taking this seriously?" 

You can marry and even (allegedly) have s*x with NPCs, but you can't even talk to most of them, you just find someone who makes eyes at you, give them thousands of dollars worth of perfume (I guess they smell funky) and chocolates (the Hero likes 'em thick and diabetic) until they propose, then that's it. You never have an actual conversation with the character you're wooing, and after they become your wife you still can't talk to them - in fact, they put a wedding ring above your wife's head because she's virtually indistinguishable from all the other NPCs. 

They talk up the whole good vs evil mechanics, but what it really boils down to is if you're good, NPCs clap at you randomly, there doesn't seem to be much else to it. Even the guild the game is based around that is supposed to be a heroes guild doesn't give a fuck if you're good or evil. You can be a little sociopath and they're like "whatever lol". Often times you get offered two opposing quests BY THE GUILD like "save these farmers from bandits" or "massacre the guards and r*pe the farmers up the butt."

It's not a bad game but it's just not scratching that itch for me.

184305990.review: Its a good game and a good franchise such a shame that xbox hasnt given this series enough attention I would really wish and like for all 3 of them or at least the other 2 to be remastered and ported to pc.

184281032.review:
Uma jornada divertida, mas com tropeços importantes

A história, por exemplo, tem uma premissa envolvente e momentos genuinamente emocionantes, mas sofre com um ritmo acelerado. Em vez de permitir que os jogadores se aprofundem no mundo de Albion e nas motivações dos personagens, o enredo muitas vezes avança de forma apressada, deixando de explorar todo o potencial narrativo. A profundidade da história é perceptível, mas nunca chega a se desdobrar totalmente como deveria.

O sistema de "karma" é esquisito, o jogador escolhe ser do bem mas em um momento do jogo o jogador é obrigado a ser do mal, porém não roubar uma casa (algo mais leve) mas nessa quest em questão é obrigado a massacrar civis e não tem como abandonar a quest ou ter outra opção e no outro dia civis do local agem com nada tivesse acontecido.

O combate, embora funcional, é apenas mediano para quem quer ser GUERREIRO. Não é ruim, mas carece de fluidez e impacto. O uso de armas brancas, arcos é variado o suficiente para manter o interesse inicial, mas rapidamente se torna repetitivo. Faltam camadas de complexidade ou desafios que realmente recompensem a maestria do jogador, Porém Magia é bem variado e divertido (como se o jogo obrigasse a ser Mago, que aliás o Boss Final é obrigado a usar Arco/Besta ou Magia)

Ainda assim, Fable brilha em seu tom leve e nos momentos em que permite que os jogadores simplesmente explorem e se divirtam. O humor, as interações com NPCs são aspectos que deixam sua marca e ajudam o jogo a resistir ao tempo.

Em resumo, Fable é um jogo divertido com uma proposta cativante, mas que falha em entregar a profundidade e o refinamento que prometeu. Apesar disso, para aqueles que podem perdoar suas imperfeições, a jornada por Albion ainda oferece momentos mágicos e memoráveis. É uma experiência para ser aproveitada, mas com expectativas ajustadas.  🌟

Jogo ótimo! Foi o primeiro que eu tive pro xbox 360, veio logo quando eu comprei, mas na época eu não consegui terminar porque a mídia física deu problema e nunca mais funcionou. Quase 10 anos desde então, mas eu nunca perdi a vontade de terminar kkkk
Ver como as suas ações e escolhas influenciam em como os npcs se comportam é bem legal. Achei isso muito bem construído no jogo.
A jogabilidade também é bem boa, e tem uma variedade interessante de armas. 
Eu só recomendo jogar no modo difícil, no qual não tem os frascos de ressureição. Eles quebram totalmente o seu personagem, porque o jogo não é lá tão difícil e esses frascos basicamente eliminam a chance de você falhar em qualquer coisa. Senti falta de ter um desafio de verdade no jogo, mas ainda me divertiu bastante.

184029645.review:
O jogo se passa no mundo de Albion, onde os jogadores assumem o papel de um herói (ou vilão), moldando seu destino com escolhas que afetam o mundo ao redor. O jogo brilha em sua narrativa, é um dos principais pontos fortes de Fable. Este jogo marcou a minha infância e revivê-lo após tanto tempo me fez perceber como ele estava à frente do seu tempo.

A remasterização, apesar de apresentar gráficos melhorados em HD e um sistema de controle mais refinado, não consegue esconder algumas limitações da estrutura do jogo original, como a IA dos inimigos e a falta de profundidade nas interações sociais. O combate também pode parecer um tanto simples e repetitivo para os padrões atuais.

183695966.review:
Хоча це одна з моїх улюблених ігор я все одно не буду її рекомендувати. Тому що цей ремастер, як і його графіка, у рази гірший від оригінальної частини Fable – The Lost Chapters. Краще придбайте оригінальну частину цієї гри. Принаймні там немає такої мильної графіки, як тут. Присутні нормальні елементи керування та більше слотів для вашої магії. Також є багато модів для старої версії гри, доступних безкоштовно. Вам не потрібно купувати їх за гроші, як до цієї версії.

Fable – The Lost Chapters – це неповторний оригінал, а Fable Anniversary – це жалюгідна пародія на стару версію цієї гри. 

https://store.steampowered.com/app/204030/Fable__The_Lost_Chapters/
